title: Live Notifications System
description:
Implement Real-Time Notification System with Toast Notifications and Notification Center

Build a comprehensive notification system that displays real-time updates to users through both temporary toast messages and a persistent notification center.

Requirements:

Toast Notifications:
- Display temporary pop-up notifications for immediate user feedback
- Support multiple notification types (success, error, warning, info)
- Include auto-dismiss functionality with configurable timeout
- Allow manual dismissal with close button
- Stack multiple toasts appropriately without overlap
- Position toasts consistently (e.g., top-right corner)
- Animate toast entry and exit smoothly

Notification Center:
- Create a centralized notification inbox accessible from the UI
- Display notification history with timestamps
- Show unread count badge on notification center icon
- Mark notifications as read/unread
- Allow individual notification dismissal
- Support bulk actions (mark all as read, clear all)
- Persist notification history across sessions

Real-Time Functionality:
- Establish WebSocket or SSE connection for live updates
- Handle connection failures and automatic reconnection
- Queue notifications received while offline
- Ensure notifications trigger immediately when events occur
- Handle multiple browser tabs/windows gracefully

Technical Considerations:
- Design notification data structure (id, type, message, timestamp, read status, metadata)
- Implement notification state management
- Create reusable notification components
- Add appropriate ARIA labels for accessibility
- Ensure notifications don't interfere with user workflows
- Set limits on notification history storage
- Handle edge cases (network interruptions, rapid notification bursts)

Success Criteria:
- Users receive notifications within 1 second of event occurrence
- Toast notifications are visible and dismissible
- Notification center maintains complete history
- System handles at least 100 notifications without performance degradation
